def: To disunite in almost any manner, either by rending, cutting,or breaking; to part; to put or keep apart; to separate; to divide;to sever; as, to sunder a rope; to sunder a limb; to sunder friends.It is sundered from the main land by a sandy plain. Carew.
Cautions; wary; watchful. [Obs. or Poetic.] -- Guard"ful*ly,adv.
A genus of plants of the order Hæmodraceæ, having two-ranked,sword-shaped leaves.
The act of imprecating, or unvoking evil upon any one; a playerthat a curse or calamnity may fall on any one; a curse.Men cowered like slaves before such horrid imprecations. Motley.
Of or pertaining to allotropism.-- Al`lo*trop"ic*al*ly, adv. Allotropic state, the severalconditions which occur in a case of allotropism.
Producing long, slender twigs or shoots.
The lower part of the abdomen.
